snippet: In an open letter to President Xi Jinping, Liu Xia said the sentencing last Sunday had been unfair and urged Mr. Xi to govern China in a way that respects the rights of individuals and avoids “ruthless suppression based on violence.”
abstract: Liu Xia, wife of jailed Nobel Peace laureate Liu Xiaobo, writes open letter to Chinese Pres Xi Jinping to protest 11-year prison term given to her brother Liu Hui; urges Xi to govern China in way that respects rights of individuals.
lead_paragraph: In an open letter to President Xi Jinping, Liu Xia said the sentencing last Sunday had been unfair and urged Mr. Xi to govern China in a way that respects the rights of individuals and avoids “ruthless suppression based on violence.”

headline.main: Protest in China Over Sentence Given to Dissident’s Brother-in-Law
headline.print_headline: China: Protest Over Sentence Given To Dissident’s Brother-in-Law
